TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DesignerActionListCollection extends System.Collections.CollectionBase

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> class represents the aggregation of all the items in a smart tag panel. The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> class contains zero or more <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> objects. Each of these lists contains zero or more objects that represent the actual items in the panel and are derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionItem> class.
The following table shows the two techniques for supplying a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> to populate the panel with items for components, including custom controls.
|Technique|Description| |---------------|-----------------| |Pull model|The designer for the component class, which is derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentDesigner> class, supplies this collection through the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentDesigner.ActionLists%2A> property. The designer infrastructure reads this property when it must display the panel.| |Push model|A <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> or <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> is supplied as a parameter in a call to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionService.Add%2A> method of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionService> associated with the component.|
The designer infrastructure constructs a panel by creating a smart tag panel, whose constructor takes two parameters of type <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection>. The collections of lists, which contain the pulled and pushed items, are merged into one panel.
Because it derives from the <xref:System.Collections.CollectionBase?displayProperty=fullName> class, <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> uses an internal <xref:System.Collections.ArrayList> to store its collection of <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> objects.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a collection of <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionItem> objects.
For a full example, see [How to: Attach Smart Tags to a Windows Forms Component](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/42cc4a0c-9ab3-47e1-93b8-03b6a6ccf233).
[!code-csharp[System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerAction.AddSmartTagsToWFComponent#8](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerAction.AddSmartTagsToWFComponent/CS/smarttags.cs#8)] [!code-vb[System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerAction.AddSmartTagsToWFComponent#8](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerAction.AddSmartTagsToWFComponent/VB/smarttags.vb#8)]
[!code-csharp[System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerAction.AddSmartTagsToWFComponent#9](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerAction.AddSmartTagsToWFComponent/CS/smarttags.cs#9)] [!code-vb[System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerAction.AddSmartTagsToWFComponent#9](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerAction.AddSmartTagsToWFComponent/VB/smarttags.vb#9)]

.method public hidebysig instance void AddRange(class System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList[] value) cil managed

Docs.param: The array of objects to add.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The new elements are added to the end of the internal list.
After validating the `value` parameter, the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection.AddRange%2A> method makes a series of calls to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection.Add%2A> method to individually add each element.

MemberSignature.Value: public void CopyTo (System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList[] array, int index);
.method public hidebysig instance void CopyTo(class System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList[] array, int32 index) cil managed

Docs.param: The one-dimensional array of type that is the destination of the elements copied from the current collection. The array must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in array at which copying begins.
Docs.summary: Copies the elements of the current collection into the supplied array, starting at the specified array index.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection.CopyTo%2A> method throws an exception while copying, the state of the destination array is undefined. For example, if an <xref:System.ArgumentException> or <xref:System.InvalidCastException> occurs, the destination array may be left in a partially filled state.

Docs.exception:
is multidimensional.
-or-
The number of elements in the current collection is greater than the available space from to the end of the destination array.
A problem occurred casting the elements of the current collection to the type of the destination array, perhaps as the result of a failed downcast.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Insert (int index, System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList value);
.method public hidebysig instance void Insert(int32 index, class System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList value) cil managed

Docs.param: The zero-based index at which value should be inserted.
The to insert into the collection.
Docs.summary: Inserts the supplied into the collection at the specified position.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the `index` parameter is equal to the value of the <xref:System.Collections.CollectionBase.Count%2A> property, the new element is added to the end of the collection.
Internally, the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> class uses a <xref:System.Collections.ArrayList?displayProperty=fullName> to contain its collection of <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> objects. Because lists maintain contiguous elements, the elements that follow the insertion point move down to accommodate the new element. This rearrangement changes the index of the elements after the insertion point.

Docs.exception: is less than 0 or greater than the count of elements in the current collection.
Docs.permission: for full access to system resources. Demand values: , . Associated state:

remarks.format: ## Remarks Internally, the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> class uses a <xref:System.Collections.ArrayList?displayProperty=fullName> to contain its collection of <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> objects. Since lists maintain contiguous elements, the elements that follow the removal point move up to occupy the vacated spot. This rearrangement changes the index of the elements after the removal point.
